news-item.title: CISF shoots contract worker in TN
news-item.text: Chennai, March 18 -- Police today arrested a Central Industrial Security Force (CISF) constable, who allegedly shot dead a contract worker of Neyveli Lignite Corporation (NLC), following a verbal duel. Meanwhile, the Neyveli township and Mandarakuppam area observed a total shut down of shops and business establishments to protest against the killing. The workers of various trade unions also joined the protests and demanded adequate compensation and protection for the victim's family. Tension prevailed due to pitched battle between the state police and locals. Additional police personnel have been deployed at the township to prevent any untoward incident. The worker M Raja(36), entered into an argument with CISF personnel Mohammed Nuwan on guard duty, when he was prevented from meeting his friend in the mine. An altercation ensued when the constable objected Raja from entering and asked him to produce an ID card. The constable fired three rounds at the worker from a close range, which resulted in the latter's death. Other workers gathered and clashed with the CISF constables. The protesters were lathicharged, when they refused to disperse. Siutation continued to remain tense in the area.
